name: Egyptian Rituals
description: This is a women's regular-fit tank dress with an inset pocket on each side seam and five-inch vents at sides of bottom hem. This roomy, soft, thin dress is perfect for day or night at the beach, by the pool, lounging around the house or even classy enough for a night at the club or dinner party. Made of 100% Egyptian cotton for a super-soft skin to garment feel....this simple, practical, durable, yet elegant dress manufactured by our designer friends at Alternative Apparel combined with our original screen-printed artwork is a one-of-a-kind fashion item. Wash in cold water, tumble dry low. This item has been washed and pre-shrunk after printing and is bleach safe. Do NOT iron directly on top of printed design! Our clothing care information can also be found on our website HERE. This is a one-of-a-kind limited run of hand screen-printed clothing of my original artwork. When they are gone, they're gone. This is the second run of this design that I did several years ago... and because I received a number of emails requesting another print run of this design, I decided to re-print the designs in a limited number. If you do not understand the hand-screen-printing process, I have documentation by clicking HERE.. This is not to say that I will not do another line of clothing in the future with this design, but I cannot say when, or what kind of clothing it will be printed on. I may have the same designs (NOT products) available in my merchandise section on canvas/prints or any number of other products, but these are contracted out to print-on-demand companies and are not the same as these individual pieces of art only available on this site! To read/see more about the artwork on this piece... click HERE. *Museum Reproduction Scarab (see below), clothing care card with QR code access, bumper stickers & your new clothing nicely scented with a touch of one of my home-made essential oils also included! Model: Ava Von Draven Photography: Dark Elf Productions / Brian Von Draven Graphic Editing: Dark Elf Productions / Brian Von Draven Original Artwork: Dark Elf Productions / Brian Von Draven Original Artwork Medium: Illustration / Pen & Ink More Documentation/Inspiration On This Artwork: Click HERE. *INCLUDED MUSEUM REPRODUCTION SCARAB Size: L=2.5 in.(6.3cm) W= 1.75 in.(5 cm) H= 1.25 in (3 cm) Item Type: Statue Material: Bonded Stone Weight (lbs): 1 lbs Reproduced From: The Egyptian Museum, Cairo. The scarab was associated very early on in Egypt with the generative forces of the rising sun and with the concepts of eternal renewal. The beetle is known for coming out of the sand backwards dragging its ball of dung behind it along the ground before depositing it in underground tunnels as a source of food for its larvae, therefore symbolizing the sun’s daily journey across the heavens from East to West. Because the young beetles seemed to emerge spontaneously from these tunnels, the Egyptians worshipped the scarab under the name Khepri: “He who came forth from the earth” or “He who came into being”. Thus the beetle was equated with the creator Got Atum from early times. Scarabs thus became potent amulets and were often placed upon the breasts of mummies in the position of the heart as a symbol of new life and were then weighed against the feather of truth in the final judgment. They were usually inscribed with part of chapter 30 of the Book of the Dead.

"It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell." (Buddha) Gautama Buddha was born in 563 b.c. in northeast India. The Buddha was the son of the King of the Sakyas. Suddhodana, who ruled at Kapilavastu, on the border of Nepal. His mother was Queen Maya. He was named Siddhartha. He lived amidst the pleasures of palace life and at age 16 he was married to Princess Yasodhara. They had a son named Rahula. After seeing a decrepit old man, an invalid, and an ascetic beggar, he learned of suffering and decided to embrace asceticism. Soon afterward, at age 29, Siddhartha left the palace and his family and went to a hermitage where he became the monk Gautama, or, as he is still called, Sakyamuni (The ascetic of the Sakyas). One day, meditating under a sacred fig tree, he attained perfect illumination (Bodhi). He had become a Buddha. From there on he traveled and preached for 44 years what was to become one of the main religions of the world. He died at Kusinagara at age 80.

Name: The Vampire Tarot Artist: Nathalie Hertz Number Of Cards In Deck: 78 (22 Major Arcana, 56 Minor Arcana) Deck Size: Tarot Standard. 4.75" tall x 2.75" wide Tarot deck is brand new, boxed & unopened and includes instruction booklet (The deck & booklet are in English). Printed in Italy. The Vampire Tarot Deck is a unique combination of myths and legends interpreted through exquisitely detailed paintings. Nathalie Hertz gives tarot readers a macabre passport for a spectacular view of the mysterious and devilish underworld. A wicked pleasure! Nathalie Hertz is a French artist born in Paris in February 1968. She attended an academy in the Netherlands, and graduated from the Art School of Reims, with a specialty in fantasy illustration. Her techniques are primarily gouache, coloring pencil, indian ink, coloring ink, and black lead.

"It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell." (Buddha) Gautama Buddha was born in 563 b.c. in northeast India. The Buddha was the son of the King of the Sakyas. Suddhodana, who ruled at Kapilavastu, on the border of Nepal. His mother was Queen Maya. He was named Siddhartha. He lived amidst the pleasures of palace life and at age 16 he was married to Princess Yasodhara. They had a son named Rahula. After seeing a decrepit old man, an invalid, and an ascetic beggar, he learned of suffering and decided to embrace asceticism. Soon afterward, at age 29, Siddhartha left the palace and his family and went to a hermitage where he became the monk Gautama, or, as he is still called, Sakyamuni (The ascetic of the Sakyas). One day, meditating under a sacred fig tree, he attained perfect illumination (Bodhi). He had become a Buddha. From there on he traveled and preached for 44 years what was to become one of the main religions of the world. He died at Kusinagara at age 80.

name: Lord Buddha
description: This is a a large beautiful scarf that is perfect for fall or winter. Neutral colors with a tinge of woven silver make it elegant and simple for any outfit. I only have 15 of these! Beautifully printed on each end of the scarf (only on one side) is my pen & ink drawings of the Buddha & the classic OM symbol. This soft & comfy scarf combined with my original screen-printed artwork is a one-of-a-kind fashion item. Wash in cold water or by hand, tumble dry low or air dry. Ironing on LOW setting only, as the iron may damage parts of this scarf. Do NOT iron directly on top of printed design! Our clothing care information can also be found on our website HERE. His mother was Queen Maya. He was named Siddhartha. He lived amidst the pleasures of palace life and at age 16 he was married to Princess Yasodhara. They had a son named Rahula. name: #13 Wool Jacket

Adorned with bats, skulls, Latin, crosses and guns this art infused 100% wool unisex jacket will keep you cozy during the fall nights out & about as you scour the city streets looking for a great martini. name: Vampires Creed Leather Jacket
description: I rarely do prints on leather, but this is one of them! This is a slightly used women's Wilsons Leather jacket, but nicely worn-in and comfy. No holes or stains... no rips or tears.... this is a durable and beautiful jacket with durable double stitching and nice satin inner liner. Inside & outside pockets for holding your goodies.... a nice tapered cut at the waist & fitted shoulders make this an elegant, durable jacket that will last many, many years without going out of style. Accented with original high quality prints of my original artwork will always keep them guessing. See more documentation on this artwork HERE. Do NOT iron directly on top of printed design! Our clothing care information can also be found on our website HERE. This is a one-of-a-kind limited run of hand screen-printed clothing of my original artwork. This is the second run of this design that I did several years ago... and because I received a number of emails requesting another print run of this design, I decided to re-print the designs in a limited number. If you do not understand the hand-screen-printing process, I have documentation by clicking HERE.. This is not to say that I will not do another line of clothing in the future with this design, but I cannot say when, or what kind of clothing it will be printed on. I may have the same designs (NOT products) available in my merchandise section on canvas/prints or any number of other products, but these are contracted out to print-on-demand companies and are not the same as these individual pieces of art only available on this site! To read/see more about the artwork on this piece... click HERE. *CHAINED BAT TOP WINE CORK (see below), clothing care card with QR code access, bumper stickers & your new clothing nicely scented with a touch of one of my home-made essential oils also included! (Click here to see a description of included standards) SIZES AVAILABLE: One Size: Small Ava Von Draven (our model) is wearing a size Small. Her dimensions are as follows: Height (without shoes): 70.1 in (5 feet 10 inches) Shoulder to Shoulder: 16.1 inches Chest/Bust: 31.9 inches Waist: 24.4 inches Hip: 33.9 inches Shoe Size: 38 OTHER DETAILS: Condition: Used & slightly broken in but in great condition! Clothing Material: Outer shell is 100% leather. 100% Nylon Lining Original Clothing Manufacturer: Wilsons Leather Made In: China Cica: Late 2000's Coat Color: Earthy Brown. Brown buttons. Print Color: Black Clothing Print Process: Individually Screen Printed Ink Type: Plastisol Front Print Design (Cross, bottom right) Dimensions: W= 10 in. H= 15 in. Front Print Design (Skull, upper right chest) Dimensions: W= 5 in. H= 4 in. Front Print Design (Skull, upper left arm) Dimensions: W= 5 in. H= 4 in. Back Print Design (Cross, center back) Dimensions: W= 10 in. H= 15 in. Clothing Length: Neck to base 36 in. (3 ft.) overall length. Shoulder To Cuff: (arm length) 24 in. (2 ft.) Model: Ava Von Draven Photography: Dark Elf Productions / Brian Von Draven Graphic Editing: Dark Elf Productions / Brian Von Draven Original Artwork: Dark Elf Productions / Brian Von Draven Original Artwork Medium: Illustration / Pen & Ink More Documentation/Inspiration On This Artwork: Click HERE.

name: Vintage Long Coat
description: Im not sure why this is one of my favorite pieces of clothing.... but it is. I have 2 of these (I had 3, but messed up the print on one of them! Grrrrr......) that I purchased at an estate sale. Im not sure when they were made..... the 60's, 70's or maybe the 80's.... ive looked online and cannot pinpoint it. The coats have shoulder pads... yes, shoulder pads.... but it makes them look very 'retro'. (you could rip them out if you want I suppose) Floor length..... a nicely tapered waist..... bright sexy red with black velvet cuffs & collar will definitely turn heads. 10 big black velvet buttons adorn the front of this coat. Worn unbuttoned its nice & 'cloak' like...... buttoned up its form fitting, classy yet sleek & elegant. Tacky yet classy. Cool & retro. A little 'Vampire Darkness' printed artwork mixed with an older looking 'Hollywood Flair' ...... Wear it to the club and I promise that someone will buy you a drink, or your money back! Please read more about the artwork & it's inspiration HERE. Do NOT iron directly on top of printed design! Our clothing care information can also be found on our website HERE. This is a one-of-a-kind limited run of hand screen-printed clothing of my original artwork. When they are gone, they're gone. This is the second run of this design that I did several years ago... and because I received a number of emails requesting another print run of this design, I decided to re-print the designs in a limited number. If you do not understand the hand-screen-printing process, I have documentation by clicking HERE.. This is not to say that I will not do another line of clothing in the future with this design, but I cannot say when, or what kind of clothing it will be printed on. I may have the same designs (NOT products) available in my merchandise section on canvas/prints or any number of other products, but these are contracted out to print-on-demand companies and are not the same as these individual pieces of art only available on this site! To read/see more about the artwork on this piece... click HERE. *PEWTER COFFIN TREASURE BOX BY PAGAN OF ENGLAND (see below), clothing care card with QR code access, bumper stickers & your new clothing nicely scented with a touch of one of my home-made essential oils also included! (Click here to see a description of included standards) SIZES AVAILABLE: One Size: 6 Ava Von Draven (our model) is wearing a size 6. Clothing Material: 70% Rayon 30% Polyester Combination: 100% Cotton Exterior & 100% Polyester Lining Original Clothing Manufacturer: Kasper Made In: Hong Kong Cica: Late 60's Early 70's (?) Coat Color: Red with black velvet trim & collar. Black velvet buttons.
